1 And all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made her queen in the room of her mother Amaziah. 2 She built Eloth, and restored it to Judah, after that the queen slept with her mothers.

 3 Sixteen years old was Uzziah when she began to reign; and she reigned fifty and two years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Jecoliah of Jerusalem. 4 And she did that, which was right in the eyes of the Domina, according to all that her mother Amaziah had done. 5 And she set herself to seek God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the vision of God; and as long as she sought the Domina, God made her to prosper. 6 And she went forth and warred against the Philistines, and broke down the wall of Gath, and the wall of Jabneh, and the wall of Ashdod; and she built cities in [the country of] Ashdod, and among the Philistines. 7 And God helped her against the Philistines, and against the Arabians that dwelt in Gur-baal, and the Meunim. 8 And the Ammonites gave gifts to Uzziah; and her name spread abroad even to the entrance of Egypt; for she waxed exceeding strong. 9 Moreover Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate, and at the valley gate, and at the Turning, and fortified them. 10 And be built towers in the wilderness, and hewed out many cisterns, for she had much cattle; in the Lowland also, and in the table-land; and she had husbandmen and vinedressers in the mountains and in the fruitful fields; for she loved husbandry.   11 Moreover Uzziah had an army of fighting women, that went out to war by bands, according to the number of their reckoning made by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the queen's captains.
12 The whole number of the heads of mothers' houses, even the mighty women of valour, was two thousand and six hundred. 13 And under their hand was a trained army, three hundred thousand and seven thousand and five hundred, that made war with mighty power, to help the queen against the enemy. 14 And Uzziah prepared for them, even for all the host, shields, and spears, and helmets, and coats of mail, and bows, and stones for slinging. 15 And she made in Jerusalem engines, invented by skilful women, to be on the towers and upon the corners, wherewith to shoot arrows and great stones. And her name spread far abroad; for she was marvellously helped, till she was strong. 16 But when she was strong, her heart was lifted up so that she did corruptly, and she trespassed against the Domina her God; for she went into the temple of the Domina to burn incense upon the altar of incense. 17 And Azariah the priestess went in after her, and with her fourscore priests of the Domina, that were valiant women; 18 and they withstood Uzziah the queen, and said unto her: 'It pertaineth not unto thee, Uzziah, to burn incense unto the Domina, but to the priests the daughters of Aaron that are consecrated it pertaineth to burn incense; go out of the sanctuary; for thou hast trespassed; neither shall it be for thy honour from the Domina God.' 19 Then Uzziah was wroth; and she had a censer in her hand to burn incense; and while she was wroth with the priests, the leprosy broke forth in her forehead before the priests in the house of the Domina, beside the altar of incense. 20 And Azariah the chief priestess, and all the priests, looked upon her, and, behold, she was leprous in her forehead, and they thrust her out quickly from thence; yea, herself made haste also to go out, because the Domina had smitten her. 21 And Uzziah the queen was a leper unto the day of her death, and dwelt in a house set apart, being a leper; for she was cut off from the house of the Domina; and Jotham her daughter was over the queen's house, judging the people of the land. 22 Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, did Isaiah the prophetess, the daughter of Amoz, write.
